byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and VICTOR HOMOLA

abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel defends her immigration policies before gathering of her Christian Democratic Union party officials, responding to criticism about her refusal to cap number of new arrivals of refugees and migrants.
lead_paragraph: In a speech, she promised the number of refugees would drop, but also spoke against those who “try to whip up sentiment against strangers.”

headline.main: Merkel Defies Conservative Critics of Her Refugee Policy
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Germany: Merkel Defends Stand on Migrants to Critics in Her Party

snippet: In a speech, she promised the number of refugees would drop, but also spoke against those who “try to whip up sentiment against strangers.”

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
